abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is unsatisfactory; sustainability is highly
            unlikely; institutional development impact is negligible;
            Bank performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance
            is satisfactory. Lessons learned comprise the following: 1)
            If feasible, private sector support programs should be
            implemented by established private sector representative
            institutions. 2) Extending projects past their closing date
            provides an opportunity to reinitiate support in countries
            experiencing political problems. 3) Experience with the
            project suggests that supporting clusters of enterprises
            would increase the efficiency of the technical assistance
            and marketing provided. 4) The matching grant program should
            follow a supply chain approach with the support implemented
            on two levels: strengthening the capacity downstream of the
            process (identification of market with a real demand) and
            strengthening the capacity upstream to help to satisfy the
            identified market.
